panels.title: Important Information

options.content:
This dashboard requires Workload/QOS counter templates. They are disabled by default because they typically slow down data collection due to a high number of metrics. Two actions are required to use this dashboard:
1. If you are using the ZapiPerf collector, then you must enable the Workload/QOS counters in $HARVEST/conf/zapiperf/default.yaml.
2. If you are using the RestPerf Collector, then you must enable the Workload/QOS counters in $HARVEST/conf/restperf/default.yaml.
3. To access the panels under `Highlights` and `Workload Read IO Type`, please enable the `workload.yaml` and `workload_volume.yaml` templates. If you're interested in viewing panels within the `Service Center` and `Latency Breakdown`, enable the `workload_detail.yaml` and `workload_detail_volume.yaml` templates. More information about [ONTAP Performance](https://kb.netapp.com/Advice_and_Troubleshooting/Data_Storage_Software/ONTAP_OS/ONTAP_9_Performance_-_Resolution_Guide).

panels.title: Highlights

panels.description: This is the rate of this workload's read operations that completed during the measurement interval.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Workloads by Read IOPS

panels.description: This is the workload's write operations that completed during the measurement interval; measured per second.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Workloads by Write IOPS

panels.description: This is the workload's other operations that completed during the measurement interval measured per second.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Workloads by Other IOPS

panels.description: Workload operations executed per second.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Workloads by Total IOPS

panels.description: This is the amount of data read per second from the filer by the workload.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Workloads by Read Throughput

panels.description: This is the amount of data written per second to the filer by the workload.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Workloads by Write Throughput

panels.description: This is the average response time for read requests that were initiated by the workload.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Workloads by Average Read Latency

panels.description: This is the average response time for write requests that were initiated by the workload.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Workloads by Average Write Latency

panels.description: This is the average response time for requests that were initiated by the workload.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Workloads by Average Latency

panels.description: This is the average number of concurrent requests for the workload.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Workloads by Concurrency

panels.description:
This panel represents the proportion of the allocated Input/Output Operations Per Second (IOPs) that is currently being used in a policy, under a fixed Quality of Service (QoS) setting. The percentage is calculated by dividing the current IOPs usage by the total available IOPs, and then multiplying the result by 100.

**Important Note:** This panel only covers policies that are shared across workloads.

targets.expr:
clamp_max(
  sum by (cluster, datacenter, policy_group) (
    (
      qos_ops{datacenter=~"$Datacenter", cluster=~"$Cluster", workload!~".*__[0-9]{4}-.*"} * 100
      / on(datacenter, cluster, policy_group)
      group_left
      label_replace(
        qos_policy_fixed_max_throughput_iops{datacenter=~"$Datacenter", cluster=~"$Cluster"},
        "policy_group",
        "$1",
        "name",
        "(.*)"
      )
    )
    * on(datacenter, cluster, policy_group)
    group_left(capacity_shared)
    label_replace(
      qos_policy_fixed_labels{datacenter=~"$Datacenter", cluster=~"$Cluster", max_throughput_iops!="", capacity_shared="true"},
      "policy_group",
      "$1",
      "name",
      "(.*)"
    )
  ),  100
)
and
topk(
  $TopResources,
  sum by (cluster, datacenter, policy_group) (
    (
      avg_over_time(
        qos_ops{datacenter=~"$Datacenter", cluster=~"$Cluster", workload!~".*__[0-9]{4}-.*"}[3h] @ end()
      )
      / on(datacenter, cluster, policy_group)
      group_left
      avg_over_time(
        (
          label_replace(
            qos_policy_fixed_max_throughput_iops{datacenter=~"$Datacenter", cluster=~"$Cluster"},
            "policy_group",
            "$1",
            "name",
            "(.*)"
          )
          * on(datacenter, cluster, policy_group)
          group_left(capacity_shared)
          label_replace(
            qos_policy_fixed_labels{datacenter=~"$Datacenter", cluster=~"$Cluster", max_throughput_iops!="", capacity_shared="true"},
            "policy_group",
            "$1",
            "name",
            "(.*)"
          )
        )[3h:] @ end()
      )
    )
  )
)

panels.title: Top $TopResources Fixed QoS Shared Policy IOPs Utilization (%)

panels.description:
This panel represents the proportion of the allocated bandwidth that is currently being used in a policy, under a fixed Quality of Service (QoS) setting. The percentage is calculated by dividing the current bandwidth usage (in MB/s) by the total available bandwidth (also in MB/s), and then multiplying the result by 100.

**Important Note:** This panel specifically covers policies that are shared across workloads.

targets.expr:
clamp_max(
  sum by (cluster, datacenter, policy_group) (
    (
      qos_total_data{datacenter=~"$Datacenter", cluster=~"$Cluster", workload!~".*__[0-9]{4}-.*"} * 100 / (1000 * 1000)
      / on(datacenter, cluster, policy_group)
      group_left
      label_replace(
        qos_policy_fixed_max_throughput_mbps{datacenter=~"$Datacenter", cluster=~"$Cluster"},
        "policy_group",
        "$1",
        "name",
        "(.*)"
      )
    )
    * on(datacenter, cluster, policy_group)
    group_left(capacity_shared)
    label_replace(
      qos_policy_fixed_labels{datacenter=~"$Datacenter", cluster=~"$Cluster", max_throughput_mbps!="", capacity_shared="true"},
      "policy_group",
      "$1",
      "name",
      "(.*)"
    )
  ),  100
)
and
topk(
  $TopResources,
  sum by (cluster, datacenter, policy_group) (
    (
      avg_over_time(
        qos_total_data{datacenter=~"$Datacenter", cluster=~"$Cluster", workload!~".*__[0-9]{4}-.*"}[3h] @ end()
      )
      / on(datacenter, cluster, policy_group)
      group_left
      avg_over_time(
        (
          label_replace(
            qos_policy_fixed_max_throughput_mbps{datacenter=~"$Datacenter", cluster=~"$Cluster"},
            "policy_group",
            "$1",
            "name",
            "(.*)"
          )
          * on(datacenter, cluster, policy_group)
          group_left(capacity_shared)
          label_replace(
            qos_policy_fixed_labels{datacenter=~"$Datacenter", cluster=~"$Cluster", max_throughput_mbps!="", capacity_shared="true"},
            "policy_group",
            "$1",
            "name",
            "(.*)"
          )
        )[3h:] @ end()
      )
    )
  )
)

panels.title: Top $TopResources Fixed QoS Shared Policy Bandwidth Utilization (%)

panels.description:
This panel represents the proportion of the allocated Input/Output Operations Per Second (IOPs) that is currently being used in a policy, under a fixed Quality of Service (QoS) setting. The percentage is calculated by dividing the current IOPs usage by the total available IOPs, and then multiplying the result by 100.

**Important Note:** This panel only covers policies that are shared across workloads.

targets.expr:
clamp_max(
  sum by (cluster, datacenter, policy_group, object_count,max_throughput_iops,max_throughput_mbps,min_throughput_iops,min_throughput_mbps) (
    (
      qos_ops{datacenter=~"$Datacenter", cluster=~"$Cluster", workload!~".*__[0-9]{4}-.*"} * 100
      / on(datacenter, cluster, policy_group)
      group_left
      label_replace(
        qos_policy_fixed_max_throughput_iops{datacenter=~"$Datacenter", cluster=~"$Cluster"},
        "policy_group",
        "$1",
        "name",
        "(.*)"
      )
    )
    * on(datacenter, cluster, policy_group)
    group_left(capacity_shared,object_count,max_throughput_iops,max_throughput_mbps,min_throughput_iops,min_throughput_mbps)
    label_replace(
      qos_policy_fixed_labels{datacenter=~"$Datacenter", cluster=~"$Cluster", max_throughput_iops!="", capacity_shared="true"},
      "policy_group",
      "$1",
      "name",
      "(.*)"
    )
  ),  100
)

panels.title: Fixed QoS Shared Policy IOPs Utilization (%)

Fixed QoS Shared Policy Utilization

panels.description: This panel represents the proportion of the allocated Input/Output Operations Per Second (IOPs) that is currently being used by Workload, under a fixed Quality of Service (QoS) setting. The percentage is calculated by dividing the current IOPs usage by the total available IOPs, and then multiplying the result by 100.

targets.expr:
clamp_max(
  (
    (
      qos_ops{datacenter=~"$Datacenter", cluster=~"$Cluster", workload=~"$Workload"}
      / on(datacenter,cluster,policy_group)
      group_left
      label_replace(
        qos_policy_fixed_max_throughput_iops{datacenter=~"$Datacenter", cluster=~"$Cluster"},
        "policy_group",
        "$1",
        "name",
        "(.*)"
      )
    ) * 100
  ),
  100
)
and
topk(
  $TopResources,
  (
    avg_over_time(
      qos_ops{datacenter=~"$Datacenter", cluster=~"$Cluster", workload=~"$Workload"}[3h] @ end()
    )
    / on(datacenter,cluster,policy_group)
    group_left
    avg_over_time(
      label_replace(
        qos_policy_fixed_max_throughput_iops{datacenter=~"$Datacenter", cluster=~"$Cluster"},
        "policy_group",
        "$1",
        "name",
        "(.*)"
      )[3h:] @ end()
    )
  )
)

panels.title: Top $TopResources Fixed QoS Workload IOPs Utilization (%)

panels.description: This panel represents the proportion of the allocated bandwidth that is currently being used by Workload, under a fixed Quality of Service (QoS) setting. The percentage is calculated by dividing the current bandwidth usage (in MB/s) by the total available bandwidth (also in MB/s), and then multiplying the result by 100.

targets.expr:
clamp_max(
  (
    (
      (
        qos_total_data{datacenter=~"$Datacenter", cluster=~"$Cluster", workload=~"$Workload"} * 100 / (1000 * 1000)
      )
      / on(datacenter,cluster,policy_group)
      group_left
      label_replace(
        qos_policy_fixed_max_throughput_mbps{datacenter=~"$Datacenter", cluster=~"$Cluster"},
        "policy_group",
        "$1",
        "name",
        "(.*)"
      )
    )
  ),
  100
)
and
topk(
  $TopResources,
  (
    avg_over_time(
      qos_total_data{datacenter=~"$Datacenter", cluster=~"$Cluster", workload=~"$Workload"}[3h] @ end()
    )
    / on(datacenter,cluster,policy_group)
    group_left
    avg_over_time(
      label_replace(
        qos_policy_fixed_max_throughput_mbps{datacenter=~"$Datacenter", cluster=~"$Cluster"},
        "policy_group",
        "$1",
        "name",

panels.title: Top $TopResources Fixed QoS Workload Bandwidth Utilization (%)

panels.description: This panel represents the proportion of the allocated Input/Output Operations Per Second (IOPs) that is currently being used by Workload, under a fixed Quality of Service (QoS) setting. The percentage is calculated by dividing the current IOPs usage by the total available IOPs, and then multiplying the result by 100.

targets.expr: qos_ops{datacenter=~"$Datacenter", cluster=~"$Cluster", workload=~"$Workload"} * on(datacenter,cluster,policy_group) group_left(max_throughput_iops,max_throughput_mbps,min_throughput_iops,min_throughput_mbps,capacity_shared) label_replace(qos_policy_fixed_labels{datacenter=~"$Datacenter", cluster=~"$Cluster", max_throughput_iops != ""}, "policy_group", "$1", "name", "(.*)")

panels.title: Fixed QoS Workload IOPs Utilization (%)

panels.description: This panel represents the proportion of the allocated bandwidth that is currently being used by Workload, under a fixed Quality of Service (QoS) setting. The percentage is calculated by dividing the current bandwidth usage (in MB/s) by the total available bandwidth (also in MB/s), and then multiplying the result by 100.
panels.title: Fixed QoS Workload Bandwidth Utilization (%)
Fixed QoS Workload Utilization

panels.description: This panel displays the percentage of Input/Output Operations Per Second (IOPs) currently in use relative to the dynamically adjusted IOPs threshold, which is set by an adaptive QoS policy. Unlike fixed QoS settings, adaptive QoS policies allow the IOPs threshold to fluctuate based on predefined criteria and workload demands. The utilization percentage is determined by taking the current IOPs usage, dividing it by the adaptive IOPs threshold at that moment, and then multiplying by 100 to get a percentage.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Adaptive QoS Workload IOPs Utilization (%)

panels.description: This panel displays the current usage of throughput as a percentage of the adaptive threshold set by an adaptive Quality of Service (QoS) policy. This metric is calculated by dividing the current throughput usage by the adaptive threshold and multiplying by 100. The panel shows data only if the block size is not set to `any`.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Adaptive QoS Workload Bandwidth Utilization (%)

panels.description: This panel displays the percentage of Input/Output Operations Per Second (IOPs) currently in use relative to the dynamically adjusted IOPs threshold, which is set by an adaptive QoS policy. Unlike fixed QoS settings, adaptive QoS policies allow the IOPs threshold to fluctuate based on predefined criteria and workload demands. The utilization percentage is determined by taking the current IOPs usage, dividing it by the adaptive IOPs threshold at that moment, and then multiplying by 100 to get a percentage.

targets.expr:
label_join(
  qos_workload_max_throughput_iops{
    datacenter=~"$Datacenter",
    cluster=~"$Cluster",
    workload=~"$Workload",
    is_adaptive="Yes"
  },
  "unique_id",
  "-",
  "datacenter",
  "cluster",
  "workload"
)

panels.title: Adaptive QoS Workload IOPs Utilization (%)

panels.description: This panel displays the current usage of throughput as a percentage of the adaptive threshold set by an adaptive Quality of Service (QoS) policy. This metric is calculated by dividing the current throughput usage by the adaptive threshold and multiplying by 100. The panel shows data only if the block size is not set to `any`.

targets.expr:
label_join(
  clamp_max(
    (
      (
        (qos_total_data{datacenter=~"$Datacenter", cluster=~"$Cluster", workload=~"$Workload"} * 100)
        / (1000 * 1000)
      )
      / on(datacenter,cluster,workload,policy_group,volume,lun,svm,qtree,file,wid)
      qos_workload_max_throughput_mbps{
        datacenter=~"$Datacenter",
        cluster=~"$Cluster",
        workload=~"$Workload",
        is_adaptive="Yes"
      }
    ),
    100
  ),
  "unique_id",
  "-",
  "datacenter",
  "cluster",
  "workload"
)

label_join(
  qos_workload_max_throughput_mbps{
    datacenter=~"$Datacenter",
    cluster=~"$Cluster",
    workload=~"$Workload",
    is_adaptive="Yes"
  },
  "unique_id",
  "-",
  "datacenter",
  "cluster",
  "workload"
)

panels.title: Adaptive QoS Workload Bandwidth Utilization (%)
Adaptive QoS Workload Utilization

Read IO Type
Service Latency by Resources

panels.description: Represents the delays in the network layer of ONTAP.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Workloads by Service Time from frontend

panels.description: Represents the delays in the data/WAFL layer of ONTAP.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Workloads by Service Time from backend

panels.description:
Represents delays caused by the cluster switches, cables, and adapters which physically connect clustered nodes. 

If the cluster interconnect component is in contention, it means high wait time for I/O requests at the cluster interconnect is impacting the latency of one or more workloads.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Workloads by Service Time from cluster

panels.description: Represents delays due to buffered write flushes, called consistency points (cp).
panels.title: Top $TopResources Workloads by Service Time from cp

panels.description: Represents slowness due to attached hard drives or solid state drives.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Workloads by Service Time from disk

panels.description:
`Note:` Typically these latencies only apply to SAN not NAS.

Represents the wait time of I/O requests by the external networking protocols on the cluster. The wait time is time spent waiting for transfer ready transactions to finish before the cluster can respond to an I/O request. If the network component is in contention, it means high wait time at the protocol layer is impacting the latency of one or more workloads.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Workloads by Service Time from network

panels.description: Represents delays due to mirroring writes to the NVRAM/NVLOG memory and to the HA partner NVRAM/NVLOG memory.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Workloads by Service Time from nvlog

panels.description: Represents delays due to operations suspending on a delay mechanism. Typically this is diagnosed by NetApp Support.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Workloads by Service Time from WAFL suspend

panels.description: Represents the throughput maximum (ceiling) setting of the storage Quality of Service (QoS) policy group assigned to the workload. If the policy group component is in contention, it means all workloads in the policy group are being throttled by the set throughput limit, which is impacting the latency of one or more of those workloads.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Workloads by Service Time from Qos throttle

panels.description: Represents the latency to a workload that is being caused by QoS throughput floor (expected) setting assigned to other workloads. If the QoS floor set on certain workloads use the majority of the bandwidth to guarantee the promised throughput, other workloads will be throttled and see more latency.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Workloads by Service Time from qos_min

panels.description: Represents the software component in the cluster involved with I/O processing between the cluster and the cloud tier on which user data is stored. If the cloud latency component is in contention, it means that a large amount of reads from volumes that are hosted on the cloud tier are impacting the latency of one or more workloads.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Workloads by Service Time from cloud
Top $TopResources Workloads by Service Time from sync_repl
Top $TopResources Workloads by Service Time from flexcache_ral
Top $TopResources Workloads by Service Time from flexcache_spinhi
Service Center

Latency Breakdown
